value.title: Looking for Self-Driving Cars? The DRIV ETF Has You Covered
value.excerpt: I ncreasing demand for electric automobiles is opening up opportunities for ETF investors to focus on the sector with funds like the Global X Autonomous & Electric Vehicles ETF (DRIV). DRIV seeks to invest in companies involved in the development of autonomous vehicle technology,

value.title: AI detects 1,210 new potential gravitational lenses in the search for dark matter
value.excerpt: Scientists used deep residual neural networks to search for the lenses in surveys of the sky. Their study could help unravel the mysteries of dark matter.

value.title: Daimler to spin off trucks in shift to electric, self-driving vehicles
value.excerpt: German carmaker Daimler plans to spin-off Daimler Truck, the world's largest truck and bus maker, to allow it to focus on zero-emission vehicles and self-driving technologies.

value.title: Dustin Diamond Was Working on Screech's Robot Ad Campaign Before His Death
value.excerpt: The ‘Saved by the Bell’ actor sadly passed away earlier this week after a short battle with advanced lung cancer.

value.title: Scientists invented an AI to detect racist people
value.excerpt: A team of researchers at the University of Virginia have developed an AI system that attempts to detect and quantify the physiological signs associated with racial bias. In other words, they’re building a wearable device that tries to identify when you’re having racist thoughts.

value.title: Researchers claim that AI-translated text is less ‘lexically’ rich than human translations
value.excerpt: Researchers at Tilburg University and the University of Maryland claim that AI-translated text is less 'rich' compared with human translations.

value.title: Scheduling work meetings in Slack with Amazon Lex
value.excerpt: Imagine being able to schedule a meeting or get notified about updates in your code repositories without leaving your preferred messaging platform. This could save you time and increase productivity. With the advent of chatbots, these mundane tasks are now easier than ever. Amazon Lex, a service for

value.title: How To Stop Your Computer Screen From Hurting Your Vision, According to an Eye Doctor
value.excerpt: L ooking at a computer screen all day forces sedentary behavior, strains your neck and shoulders, and—unsurprisingly—it’s incredibly hard on your eyes. Your computer screen is hurting your eyes because their ability to manage light diminishes over time,

value.title: This AI maths whiz creates tough new problems for humans to solve
value.excerpt: Algorithm named after mathematician Srinivasa Ramanujan suggests interesting formulae, some of which are difficult to prove true.

value.title: New Amazon CEO Andy Jassy Loves Fossil Fuels and Facial Recognition
value.excerpt: Jassy, who will replace Bezos this year, has a deeply concerning track record on everything from antitrust to killer robots.

value.title: Microsoft launches Custom Neural Voice in limited access
value.excerpt: Microsoft today launched Custom Neural Voice in limited preview, a service that allows customers to create custom voices using AI.

value.title: Are you talking to me? Azure AI brings iconic characters to life with Custom Neural Voice
value.excerpt: The post Are you talking to me? Azure AI brings iconic characters to life with Custom Neural Voice appeared first on The AI Blog.

value.title: The Future Of Work Now: AI-Driven Policing In Wilmington, NC
value.excerpt: Police officers in Wilmington, NC now use two AI-based tools from ShotSpotter for gunshot detection and patrol recommendations.

value.title: Self-Driving Cars And Parallels To Minecraft
value.excerpt: Minecraft is big business. This quite revered and now over a decade old video game has reportedly attained more than 126 million monthly active players and has sold well beyond 200 million copies of the gaming software.

value.title: Reverie Labs raises $25 million for its AI drug discovery platform
value.excerpt: Reverie Labs, a startup using AI to develop new medicines, today announced the closure of its $25 million series A round. The company says the capital will be used to advance its internal and partnered drug discovery program,

value.title: How To Safeguard Students’ Mental Health While Learning From Home
value.excerpt: It’s no secret that students do their best work when they can fully concentrate on their education. But, thanks to the various lockdowns and learning from home, this tends to be a lot easier said than done, creating a huge number of other home-based ...

value.title: If You Have A Luxury Handbag To Sell, Rebag’s New Clair AI Makes It Easier
value.excerpt: In an effort to further distinguish itself amid the increasingly competitive luxury resale channel, Rebag is launching Clair AI image recognition technology for luxury products.

value.title: Cloud services spending jumps by $10 billion in final quarter of 2020
value.excerpt: Driven by demand from remote workers and students as well as content streaming and online gaming, cloud services took in $40 billion in sales last quarter, says Canalys.

value.title: AI finds more than 1,200 gravitational lensing candidates
value.excerpt: A research team with participation by Berkeley Lab physicists has used artificial intelligence to identify more than 1,200 possible gravitational lenses—objects that can be powerful markers for the distribution of dark matter.

value.title: Carecard Launches Artificial Intelligence-Powered Platform to Tackle the $450 Billion Dollar Prescription Market
value.excerpt: Carecard launches to make healthcare affordable for everyone by tackling the $450 billion dollar prescription market. Carecard is powered by advanced AI technology, and the Company has secured relationships with major pharmacies nationwide,

value.title: Community Health Network prescribes AI to combat COVID-19
value.excerpt: Community Health Network is employing an AI platform from Jvion to assign COVID-19 risk scores and drive an education outreach initiative.

value.title: Deepgram raises $25 million to build custom enterprise speech recognition models
value.excerpt: Deepgram, a startup developing custom voice recognition models for enterprise customers, raised $25 million in funding.

value.title: Granulate raises $30 million for AI that optimizes server workloads
value.excerpt: Granulate, a startup developing AI technologies to optimize server workloads, has raised $30 million in venture funding.

value.title: Short Interest in Global X Robotics & Artificial Intelligence ETF (NASDAQ:BOTZ) Increases By 39.1%
value.excerpt: Global X Robotics & Artificial Intelligence ETF (NASDAQ:BOTZ) was the recipient of a significant growth in short interest in January. As of January 15th, there was short interest totalling 295,500 shares,
